extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup finely chopped green or red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: finely chopped green or red bell pepper

title: Grilled Tuna Melts
summary: Grilled Tuna Melts is a gluten free and pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 2 and costs $1.56 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 37g of protein, 24g of fat, and a total of 392 calories. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. A mixture of celery, bell pepper, butter, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the unsalted butter you could follow this main course with the Almond Milk Chocolate Pudding as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 11 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 72%. This score is good. Try Grilled Stuffed Tuna Melts, Tuna Melts, and Tuna Melts for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 34 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Provenance Vineyards Napa Valley Merlot
productMatches.description:
Our 2006 Merlot isn't shy, with its deep, dark garnet hue and abounding aromas of rich black
cherry, cassis and clove. Approachable, integrated tannins frame the generous dark fruit
flavors and coat the palate with soft velvet. The long, fruity finish, laced with autumn spices,
ends with a lively cranberry zing. "This is a very classy wine from a gorgeous vintage. Take
that, Miles!" laughs Winemaker Tom Rinaldi, with a reference to the film Sideways.
